div.pre: 2082 Villabate, near Palermo, 1893 (1161) Burial: c. 450 B.C. (Herzfelder); 450-445 (Jenkins) Contents: c. 250 AR. Pot hoard Rhegium: 1 tetradr. (as Herzfelder 5c) Acragas: 18+ tetradr. Gela: 17+ tetradr. (to Jenkins 350) Himera: 9+ tetradr. (to Gutmann-Schwa- bacher 6) Leontini: 10+ tetradr. (quadr. types only) Messana: 13+ tetradr. (incl. types with Σ) Syracuse: 79+ tetradr. (to Boehringer 535) Disposition: Salinas (for Palermo); Virzi; Evans, then Jameson 579, 608, 620, 735, 737-8, 740, 761, 768 † Evans, NC 1894, pp. 201-16, illus. Herzfelder, Rhegion, pp. 47-8 Kraay, Greek Coins and History (London, 1969), pp. 35-7 Jenkins, Gela, pp. 66-7, 160 Evans (p. 201) notes that two other hd. had been found in recent years at the same spot; one of them may have been no. 2076 above
